0.rationale:
- From (5,7), the four possible moves (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT) are all within the 10x10 board and do not collide with your own body (you have length 1) or the enemy’s body, so they are all currently safe.
- There is no apple in any of the immediate next cells, so you won’t grow this turn regardless of choice.
- The nearest obvious apples are at (0,8) and (2,8). Moving UP places you on the same row as those apples and sets up a straightforward path to reach them in a couple of moves, keeping options open.
- The enemy is far away at (8,0); moving UP keeps you away from potential head-on collisions on the lower rows and gives you more space to maneuver on the top side of the board.
- Short-term plan: head toward the top apples by going UP this turn, then reassess next turn to decide between continuing upward or veering toward a nearby apple.

Long-term plan note for upcoming turns:
- If you reach y=8 safely, prioritize (2,8) then (0,8). Avoid getting boxed in by the enemy by keeping distance and using the open top region to make incremental gains on apples.

UP
